messages.subject: Re: Q about radical unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: I second that it s a great resource! And, because it s written in a Q&A type style, it s easy to just read a section and put it down and come back to it later.
messages.messageBody:
I second that it's a great resource! And, because it's written in a Q&A
type style, it's easy to just read a section and put it down and come
back to it later. Which makes it great bathroom reading for reluctant
spouses :-) It's not a huge time commitment which sometimes gets in the
way of people, especially those who are hesitant in the first place.

Deb

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Q about radical unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: Maybe it should be in my sig line!  _Parenting a Free Child, An Unschooled Life_ by our very own Rue Kream (a moderator here). It s worth its weight in
messages.messageBody:
Maybe it should be in my sig line! <G>

_Parenting a Free Child, An Unschooled Life_ by our very own Rue Kream
(a moderator here).

It's worth its weight in gold---and has a picture of Rue's cute butt on
the cover. <g>

Available directly from the author here: www.freechild.info

~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
http://www.LiveandLearnConference.org

-----Original Message-----
From: Sharissa13 <sharissa13@...>


From the conversations going on, I think what I am
trying to do is radical unschooling. My husband isn't
thrilled about regular unschooling, let alone that I
want my child to go at his own pace and in his own
way. Can anyone recommend a good book that describes
radical unschooling?

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Q about radical unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/17/2008 10:07:38 A.M. Pacific Daylight Time, sharissa13@yahoo.com writes: Can  anyone recommend a good book that describes radical
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/17/2008 10:07:38 A.M. Pacific Daylight Time,
sharissa13@... writes:

Can anyone recommend a good book that describes
radical unschooling?



___________________

If it hasn't been said yet (I have way too many groups I belong to - over
200 emails, lol!), Rue Kream's "Parenting a Free Child" is an EXCELLENT book and
one that describes life itself. A great read!

Karen

messages.messageBody:
From the conversations going on, I think what I am
trying to do is radical unschooling. My husband isn't
thrilled about regular unschooling, let alone that I
want my child to go at his own pace and in his own
way. Can anyone recommend a good book that describes
radical unschooling?
